abstract: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reports that the stranding of 80 endangered Guadalupe fur seals on coast of California in 2015 is unusual mortality event; average annual number of standings is 10 to 12; designation of event is meant to focus attention on causes for the strandings of the threatened species.
lead_paragraph: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration declared the strandings, 80 so far this year, an “unusual mortality event.”

headline.main: Increase in Fur Seal Strandings on California Coast
headline.print_headline: National Briefing | West; California: Large Increase Seen in Strandings of Fur Seals

snippet: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration declared the strandings, 80 so far this year, an “unusual mortality event.”
